intro: Vincetoxicum macranthum, commonly known as the great antirrhinum, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are typically hairy and have a rough texture. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in clusters, usually in shades of red, orange, or yellow, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in partial to full sun and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Vincetoxicum macranthum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and naturalized areas.
